import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

setup_chart_style(style='light', dpi=150)

fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(12, 6))

categories = ['KILLING\n(Military)', 'CURING\n(Medical Research)']
spending = [2700, 68]  # In billions

for bar, value in zip(bars, spending):

    ax1.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2., height + 50,
            f'${value:,}B', ha='center', va='bottom',
            color=COLOR_BLACK, fontsize=32, fontweight='bold')

ax1.set_ylim(0, 3000)
ax1.axis('off')  # Remove axes - labels are on the bars

ax2.text(0.5, 0.7, '40X', ha='center', va='center',
         fontsize=120, color=COLOR_RED, fontweight='bold')
ax2.text(0.5, 0.4, 'MORE ON', ha='center', va='center',
         fontsize=40, color=COLOR_BLACK, fontweight='bold')
ax2.text(0.5, 0.2, 'KILLING', ha='center', va='center',
         fontsize=60, color=COLOR_RED, fontweight='bold')
ax2.set_xlim(0, 1)
ax2.set_ylim(0, 1)
ax2.axis('off')

# Add watermark
add_watermark(fig)

# Save the figure
plt.savefig('brain/charts/military-vs-medical-research-spending-comparison.png',

plt.show()
